title: Postal voting in the 2020 United States elections
added: On October 18, 2020, a ballot drop-off box in [[Baldwin Park, California]] was set on fire, destroying up to 100 ballots. As of October 19, the case is being investigated as potential arson.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.latimes.com/california/story/2020-10-19/ballot-box-fire-baldwin-park-may-be-arson|title=Ballot box fire in Baldwin Park may be arson, officials say|work=The Los Angeles Times|date=October 19, 2020|accessdate=October 19, 2020|first=Hayley|last=Smith}}</ref>

title: Postal voting in the 2020 United States elections
added: On October 28, the Supreme Court denied a request from Republicans and the Trump campaign to allow ballots to be received up to three days after election day, rather than the nine day limit that had been set by the State Board of Elections amidst the pandemic.<ref>https://www.cnn.com/2020/10/28/politics/north-carolina-supreme-court-nine-days/index.html</ref>

title: Postal voting in the 2020 United States elections
added: On October 28, the Supreme Court denied a request from Republicans and the Trump campaign to allow ballots to be received up to three days after election dayin North Carolina, rather than the nine day limit that had been set by the State Board of Elections amidst the pandemic.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.cnn.com/2020/10/28/politics/north-carolina-supreme-court-nine-days/index.html|title=North Carolina can count votes received 9 days after Election Day, Supreme Court rules|first=Ariane de Vogue, CNN Supreme Court|last=Reporter|website=CNN}}</ref>
